title: The Funniest Karaoke Songs That’ll Make the Crowd Go Wild

steps.content: Can’t sing but want to drop a sick beat on the mic? Well, these karaoke songs are perfect for you! These songs have little singing and require extra silliness to pull off—they’re simply classic. Plus, they’re sure to make the crowd laugh, get people singing along, and raise the room’s energy! “Tequila” by The Champs “Mahna Mahna” by The Muppets “Shake Your Booty” by KC & The Sunshine Band “I’m Too Sexy” by Right Said Fred “A Thousand Miles” by Vanessa Carlton “Short People” by Randy Newman “The Duck Song” by Bryant Oden “The Banana Boat Song (Day-O)” by Harry Belafonte “Mambo No. 5” by Lou Bega “Gangnam Style” by Psy “I’m A Believer” by The Monkees “Who Let The Dogs Out” by The Baha Men “The Macarena” by Los Del Rio “The Final Countdown” by Europe “What Does the Fox Say?” by Ylvis “Boogie Shoes” by KC & The Sunshine Band “Call Me Maybe” by Carly Rae Jepsen “Thriller” by Michael Jackson “Bubblegum” by Jason Derulo “Wobble” by V.I.C. “Hot In Herre” by Nelly “Drop It Like It’s Hot” by Snoop Dogg and Pharrell Williams “Thrift Shop” by Macklemore and Ryan Lewis “Harlem Shake” by Baauer “Sexy And I Know It” by LMFAO “Turn Down for What” by DJ Snake and Lil Jon “Friday” by Rebecca Black

What’s funnier than a bad singer performing as if they could sing? Show off your pitchy tone and wild notes with these songs. They’re normally held for the professionals, but you’re a Professional Silly Goose—own your voice, get on stage, and have a blast! “All I Want For Christmas Is You” by Mariah Carey “Let It Go” from Frozen “Before He Cheats” by Carrie Underwood “Shallow” by Lady Gaga and Bradley Cooper “Someone Like You” by Adele “Defying Gravity” from Wicked “All Too Well” by Taylor Swift “It’s All Coming Back To Me Now” by Celine Dion “I Don’t Want to Miss a Thing” by Aerosmith “I Have Nothing” by Whitney Houston “Love Me Harder” by Ariana Grande and The Weeknd “Without You” by Mariah Carey “Proud Mary” by Tina Turner “Dangerous Woman” by Ariana Grande “I Will Always Love You” by Whitney Houston “Stone Cold” by Demi Lovato “Womanizer” by Britney Spears “Cry Me A River” by Michael Buble “Hello” by Adele “My Immortal” by Evanescence “Chandelier” by Sia “Hurt” by Christina Aguilera

Gentlemen, these humorous songs are ideal for getting anyone to laugh during karaoke night. They’re full of silly beats, jokes, and more! Plus, you can amp up the antics with your own physical flair to really make the ladies swoon. “I Just Can’t Wait To Be King” from The Lion King “Feel Good Inc” by Gorillaz “Uptown Girl” by Billy Joel “Should I Stay or Should I Go” by The Clash “Africa” by TOTO “Stacy’s Mom” by Fountains Of Wayne “Never Gonna Give You Up” by Rick Astley “Don’t Worry Be Happy” by Bobby McFerrin “Stayin’ Alive” by Bee Gees “Why Can’t We Be Friends” by War “We Built This City” by Starship “I Gotta Feeling” by Black Eyed Peas “You Shook Me All Night Long” by AC/DC “Baby Got Back” by Sir Mix-A-Lot “Ice Ice Baby” by Vanilla Ice “All Star” by Smash Mouth “Kiss” by Prince “Teenage Dirtbag” by Wheatus “The Boys Are Back in Town” by Thin Lizzy “Can’t Feel My Face” by The Weeknd “Baby” by Justin Bieber “Honey, I’m Good.” by Andy Grammer

Girls, these karaoke songs are sure to make you the talk of the evening! These tunes are full of silly lyrics, jazzy melodies, and humorous laments. So, show off your theatrics and up the drama with these captivating numbers: “Barbie Girl” by Aqua “Girls Just Want to Have Fun” by Cyndi Lauper “Man! I Feel Like a Woman!” by Shania Twain “Sk8ter Boi” by Avril Lavigne “thank u, next” by Ariana Grande “Fergalicious” by Fergie “Bad Romance” by Lady Gaga “Genie In a Bottle” by Christina Aguilera “Jenny from the Block” by Jennifer Lopez “Total Eclipse of the Heart” by Bonnie Tyler “Super Bass” by Nicki Minaj “Respect” by Aretha Franklin “Oops…I Did It Again” by Britney Spears “I Will Survive” by Gloria Gaynor “Single Ladies (Put a Ring on It)” by Beyoncé “Shake It Off” by Taylor Swift “I’m Every Woman” by Whitney Houston “Hit Me with Your Best Shot” by Pat Benatar “Hollaback Girl” by Gwen Stefani “You’re So Vain” by Carly Simon “So What” by P!nk “I Kissed A Girl” by Katy Perry “Wrecking Ball” by Miley Cyrus “We Are Never Ever Getting Back Together” by Taylor Swift

These funny couples’ karaoke songs are ideal for lovebirds of all ages! They’re the perfect duets with a hint of humor that are sure to captivate your audience and let you put on a show. “Don’t Go Breaking My Heart” by Elton John and Kiki Dee “Summer Nights” from Grease “Love Shack” by The B-52s “Suddenly Seymour” from Little Shop of Horrors “Endless Love” by Diana Ross and Lionel Richie “Love Is An Open Door” from Frozen “Dilemma” by Nelly and Kelly Rowland “It’s Your Love” by Tim McGraw and Faith Hill “I Got You Babe” by Sonny and Cher “Die With A Smile” by Lady Gaga and Bruno Mars “Timber” by Pitbull and Kesha “Humuhumunukunukuapua’a” from High School Musical 2 “It Ain’t Me Babe” by Joan Baez and Bob Dylan “Somebody That I Used to Know” by Gotye and Kimbra “It Takes Two” by Rod Stewart and Tiny Turner “This Is Me” from Camp Rock “We Don’t Talk Anymore” by Charlie Puth and Selena Gomez “Anything You Can Do” from Annie Get Your Gun “Lay All Your Love On Me” by ABBA Sixteen Going on Seventeen” from The Sound of Music

Grab your bestest friends and pull them all on stage for one of these fun numbers! These karaoke songs are super fun to sing with two or more friends. If you want to be extra fancy, you can even choreograph your own dance number to go along with the beat! “The Boy Is Mine” by Brandy and Monica “Opposites Attract” by Paula Abdul “Hakuna Matata” from The Lion King “It’s Raining Men” by The Weather Girls “Under Pressure” by Queen and David Bowie “I Don’t Care” by Ed Sheeran and Justin Bieber “Moves Like Jagger” by Maroon 5 and Christina Aguilera “Hips Don’t Lie” by Shakira and Wyclef Jean “Monopoly” by Ariana Grande and Victoria Monét “Slumber Party” by Britney Spears and Tinashe “Swish Swish” by Katy Perry and Nicki Minaj “Telephone” by Lady Gaga and Beyoncé “Gaston” from Beauty and the Beast “Ain’t No Mountain High Enough” by Marvin Gaye and Tammi Terrell “Whiskey Lullaby” by Brad Paisley and Alan Jackson “Dilemma” by Nelly and Kelly Rowland “Old Town Road” by Lil Nas X and Billy Ray Cyrus

Drag your friends, colleagues, or loved ones on stage with you for one of these silly songs. These karaoke songs have multiple parts, making them ideal for larger groups of people. After all, the more people on stage, the sillier the performance can be! “I Want It That Way” by Backstreet Boys “Love Rollercoaster” by Red Hot Chili Peppers “Kiss and Make Up” by BLACKPINK and Dua Lipa “We Don’t Talk About Bruno” from Encanto “What Makes You Beautiful” by One Direction “2 Become 1” by Spice Girls “Bohemian Rhapsody” by Queen “Dancing Queen” by ABBA “Don’t Stop Believin’” by Journey “Bye Bye Bye” by *NSYNC “Dynamite” by BTS “YMCA” by Village People “Shout Out To My Ex” by Little Mix “I’m Gonna Be (500 Miles)” by The Proclaimers “Waterloo” by ABBA “Macarena” by Los Del Rio “ABC” by The Jackson 5 “Everybody (Backstreet’s Back)” by Backstreet Boys “Sucker” by Jonas Brothers

Perhaps you’re not the strongest singer, or maybe this is your first time doing karaoke. No matter, there’s a song for you to sing! Karaoke is all about having a good time, so try performing one of these easy karaoke songs to get yourself on stage and improve your confidence: “Hey Ya!” by Outkast “Good as Hell” by Lizzo “...Baby One More Time” by Britney Spears “Mr. Brightside” by The Killers “Party In The U.S.A.” by Miley Cyrus “Sweet Caroline” by Neil Diamond “Sweet Child O’ Mine” by Guns N’ Roses “Drops of Jupiter (Tell Me)” by Train “Wagon Wheel” by Darius Rucker “Walking On Sunshine” by Katrina & The Waves “Livin’ On A Prayer” by Bon Jovi “Thank You for Being a Friend” by Andrew Gold “Goodbye Earl” by The Chicks “I Love Rock ‘N Roll” by Joan Jett & the Blackhearts “You Can’t Always Get What You Want” by The Rolling Stones

Want to get on and off the stage quickly? If so, these songs are for you! These tunes are super quick, easy to follow, and perfect for bigger karaoke stars. Add a few dance moves, and you’re golden. “Since U Been Gone” by Kelly Clarkson “Pocketful of Sunshine” by Natasha Bedingfield “Jolene” by Dolly Parton “Build Me Up Buttercup” by The Foundations “All the Small Things” by Blink 182 “Little Darlin’” by The Diamonds “Love Potion Number 9” by The Searchers “You Really Got Me” by The Kinks “Ain’t No Sunshine” by Bill Withers “Norwegian Wood” by The Beatles “The Letter” by The Box Tops “Hit the Road, Jack” by Ray Charles “Great Balls of Fire” by Jerry Lee Lewis “From Me To You” by The Beatles “Breaking Glass” by David Bowie “Fell In Love With a Girl” by The White Stripes “Vaseline” by Elastica “Allison” by Pixies “Lazing On a Sunday Afternoon” by Queen

steps.title: Get extra laughs from the crowd by dancing and acting out the lyrics.
steps.content: Get extra laughs from the crowd by dancing and acting out the lyrics. So, you’re hopping on stage just to make your friends giggle or impress your crush with your comedic skills, huh? Well, if you really want to put on a silly show, here are a few tips for the best funny performance: Dance. A choreographed number thrown into the middle of your song is a great way to capture the crowd! Plus, you get bonus points for being extra silly with awkward twists, turns, and hand movements. Act out the lyrics. Don’t be afraid to be overdramatic! Be melodramatic with a sad song, or give a bad impression of the original artist. Have a costume change. If you’re planning ahead, consider switching outfits or changing up your wardrobe mid-performance. Revealing a sparkling jumpsuit underneath your business getup will be a crowd stopper! Use props. The microphone isn’t the only thing you have to work with. Grab a glass from the bar, borrow a friend’s hat, or bring a feathery boa from home to amp up your performance. Work with the space. Own the space you have to perform in. If allowed, walk on a table or move closer to the audience. Don’t be afraid to strut across that stage!

steps.title: Sing a song you’re comfortable with.
steps.content: Sing a song you’re comfortable with. One of the best ways to improve your karaoke skills is to sing something you know. Pick a song that isn’t super challenging for your vocal range, preferably one you know really well. In other words, go for that song you sing in the shower constantly! [1] X Research source

steps.title: Practice, practice, practice.
steps.content: Practice, practice, practice. If you really want to impress someone with your karaoke skills, the best thing you can do is practice. Rehearse your go-to karaoke song in the comfort of your own home or while driving to and from work every day. The more comfortable you are with the notes, the more confident you’ll appear on stage. [2] X Research source

steps.title: Know your audience.
steps.content: Know your audience. Before stepping on stage, consider who you’re singing to. Is it a group of colleagues, close friends, or family members? Make sure the song you pick is appropriate for the audience. This can help you be more confident and impressive. [3] X Research source For example, you might not want to choose a super sexy song to sing in front of your boss or mother-in-law.

steps.title: Be ready to fail.
steps.content: Be ready to fail. We hate to break it to you, but failure is a part of life—it’s normal. If your voice cracks or you say the wrong lyric, no worries! You’re ultimately singing karaoke to have fun. It’s very likely that the only person judging you is yourself, so don’t be afraid to make mistakes. After all, the only way you improve and get better is to make mistakes . [4] X Research source

steps.title: Own it and have fun!
steps.content: Own it and have fun! Whatever you do on stage, do it with confidence—don’t hesitate in your decisions! Karaoke is supposed to be fun. At the end of the day, this isn’t a singing competition. You don’t need to show that you’re the best singer, but you can prove that you’re the most fun! So, go on that stage, have fun, and show off your confidence .
